publications.title: Linking influenza epidemic onsets to covariates at different scales using a dynamical model
publications.subtitle: PeerJ
publications.description: Evaluating the factors favoring the onset of influenza epidemics is a critical public health issue for surveillance, prevention and control. While past outbreaks provide important insights for understanding epidemic onsets, their statistical analysis is challenging since the impact of a factor can be viewed at different scales. Indeed, the same factor can explain why epidemics are more likely to begin (i) during particular weeks of the year (global scale); (ii) earlier in particular regions (spatial scale) or years (annual scale) than others and (iii) earlier in some years than others within a region (spatiotemporal scale).Here, we present a statistical approach based on dynamical modeling of infectious diseases to study epidemic onsets. We propose a method to disentangle the role of covariates at different scales and use a permutation procedure to assess their significance. Epidemic data gathered from 18 French regions over six epidemic years were provided by the Regional Influenza Surveillance Group (GROG) sentinel network.

publications.title: Quantifying the role of weather on seasonal influenza
publications.subtitle: BMC Public Health
publications.description: Improving knowledge about influenza transmission is crucial to upgrade surveillance network and to develop accurate predicting models to enhance public health intervention strategies. Epidemics usually occur in winter in temperate countries and during the rainy season for tropical countries, suggesting a climate impact on influenza spread. Despite a lot of studies, the role of weather on influenza spread is not yet fully understood. In the present study, we investigated this issue at two different levels. First, we evaluated how weekly (intra-annual) incidence variations of clinical diseases could be linked to those of climatic factors. We considered that only a fraction of the human population is susceptible at the beginning of a year due to immunity acquired from previous years. Second, we focused on epidemic sizes (cumulated number of clinical reported cases) and looked at how their inter-annual and regional variations could be related to differences in the winter climatic conditions of the epidemic years over the regions. We quantified the impact of fifteen climatic variables in France using the Réseau des GROG surveillance network incidence data over eleven regions and nine years.

I had the pleasure of working with her for almost 2 years at Capital Float, collaborating on several backend web development projects. She is the go-to person for getting things done quickly and her talent for juggling multiple projects is impeccable. She has a charming personality and quirky humor, which made her the live wire of the team. As a team member and a diligent coder, Aishwarya earns my highest recommendation.”

LinkedIn User “I had the pleasure of working with Aish for two years at Cerner on a variety of projects. She often took on tasks that were new or daunting and volunteered to learn new technologies. She was always willing to share her knowledge and act as a mentor to team members. Aish would be an asset to any team.”

detailed_profile.name: Jorge Santos
detailed_profile.position: Operating Partner at C2 Capital Partners
detailed_profile.about: Seasoned Executive focused on Healthcare, with extensive skills in Strategy, Operational Turnaround, Data & Analytics, Finance and Project Management. With over 15 years of experience in large-sized companies and consulting services, it brings a strong analytical approach to strategy definition and problem-solving and solid execution capabilities that drive revenue and profitability growth.

positions.subtitle: Luz Saúde
positions.description: Leadership of Data & Analytics strategy definition and implementation, focusing on building a center of excellence/expertise at the group level, supporting all business units and ongoing transformation projects:> Advanced Analytics – Creation and development of a new area focused on using AI and advanced data modelling to respond to the company’s business needs and to identify top opportunities to improve top and bottom line growth.> Business Intelligence - Management of the design and implementation of business intelligence platform focused on financial, operational and clinical quality performance evaluation, which became the core data tool for the whole group.> Transformation Projects - Leadership of internal team focused on profitability improvement initiatives and operational turnaround projects (e.g. Value Based Healthcare), in close cooperation with all business units and central services, using Data & Analytics capabilities.
positions.title: Head of Strategic Planning, Business Intelligence and Advanced Analytics
positions.description_html:
Leadership of Data & Analytics strategy definition and implementation, focusing on building a center of excellence/expertise at the group level, supporting all business units and ongoing transformation projects:
> Advanced Analytics – Creation and development of a new area focused on using AI and advanced data modelling to respond to the company’s business needs and to identify top opportunities to improve top and bottom line growth.
> Business Intelligence - Management of the design and implementation of business intelligence platform focused on financial, operational and clinical quality performance evaluation, which became the core data tool for the whole group.
> Transformation Projects - Leadership of internal team focused on profitability improvement initiatives and operational turnaround projects (e.g. Value Based Healthcare), in close cooperation with all business units and central services, using Data & Analytics capabilities.

positions.subtitle: Luz Saúde
positions.description: In addition to the previous functions, coordination of the whole process of making Luz Saúde a publicly traded company, as well as of the sale of the company through a highly competitive tender purchase offering process:> IPO Process Coordinator – management of Luz Saúde’s whole IPO process in 2014 (ca. 150M€ share capital float), leading a team composed by investment bankers, consultants and lawyers, along with doing the company’s roadshow for investors. > Investors Liaison – exclusive point of contact in Luz Saúde for investors, analysts, regulators and other stakeholders, in addition to coordinating statutory reporting.> Company Sale Process – management of Luz Saúde’s sale process, being responsible for tender offers analysis and negotiation in conjunction with external communication.
positions.title: Head of Business and Financial Planning & Control and Investor Relations
positions.description_html:
In addition to the previous functions, coordination of the whole process of making Luz Saúde a publicly traded company, as well as of the sale of the company through a highly competitive tender purchase offering process:
> IPO Process Coordinator – management of Luz Saúde’s whole IPO process in 2014 (ca. 150M€ share capital float), leading a team composed by investment bankers, consultants and lawyers, along with doing the company’s roadshow for investors.
> Investors Liaison – exclusive point of contact in Luz Saúde for investors, analysts, regulators and other stakeholders, in addition to coordinating statutory reporting.
> Company Sale Process – management of Luz Saúde’s sale process, being responsible for tender offers analysis and negotiation in conjunction with external communication.

positions.subtitle: Luz Saúde
positions.description: Coordination of a core multi-disciplinary team in close collaboration/joint work with business units’ management teams, business and financial controllers, clinical teams and support areas (matrix organization), being responsible for:> Business Planning & Control - Responsible for designing and managing planning processes at consolidated and business unit level (21 hospitals/clinics), as well as performance evaluation vs. targets and coordinating management reporting. > Financial Management - Control of Luz Saúde’s funding strategy, according to liquidity needs and expansion projects, including negotiation of debt contracts with banks (over 250M€ negotiated across 5 years with estimated funding cost savings of 1.0-1.5 p.p.) > Executive Board support - Close work with the Board on strategic areas, through operational performance evaluation and specific deep-dive analyses of hot topics for the Executive team, as well as collaboration with Business Development department in organic growth and M&A opportunities evaluation and business plan design.
positions.title: Head of Business and Financial Planning & Control
positions.description_html:
Coordination of a core multi-disciplinary team in close collaboration/joint work with business units’ management teams, business and financial controllers, clinical teams and support areas (matrix organization), being responsible for:
> Business Planning & Control - Responsible for designing and managing planning processes at consolidated and business unit level (21 hospitals/clinics), as well as performance evaluation vs. targets and coordinating management reporting.
> Financial Management - Control of Luz Saúde’s funding strategy, according to liquidity needs and expansion projects, including negotiation of debt contracts with banks (over 250M€ negotiated across 5 years with estimated funding cost savings of 1.0-1.5 p.p.)
> Executive Board support - Close work with the Board on strategic areas, through operational performance evaluation and specific deep-dive analyses of hot topics for the Executive team, as well as collaboration with Business Development department in organic growth and M&A opportunities evaluation and business plan design.

detailed_profile.name: Jakub Chlad
detailed_profile.position: Head of Late Collections at Home Credit Philippines
detailed_profile.about: A manager with wide and various experience on emerging markets of Asia and post-Soviet area. Sales, financial services, mass processes, debt collections, administration of facilities, security and anti-fraud, legal and compliance, securitisation, debt sale, financial market, call-centres, product development, network management, incentives schemes – these are areas I have dealt with. What makes me valuable for an organisation is my creativity, freshness of outlook and ability of rethinking and redesigning processes. My strong international legal background makes me confident while operating in foreign legal environments. I have unique crisis management experience as well as outstanding ability of learning and adapting to the demanding work environment. In addition, I am skilled in mentoring and have got a couple of successful stories of helping my subordinates to achieve new level in their performance, maturity and career. Therefore, several times I was able to successfully run difficult projects with junior team who had no relevant experience. I have excellent command of time management.

positions.description: Designing entirely new process of field collection, adjusted to group business indicators and specific of local portfolio Introducing multiply process amendments including centralized planning of cases to be visited in order to drive in real time the most desired indicatorsRow of methodological changes inter alia early morning visits, cards with phone numbers, legal documentsMoving the performance in 10 month from one of the worst in The Home Credit Group to the best oneManaging the team of 3000 people + growing roughly by 100-200 people every monthDoubling a recovery rate on consumer durables and cash loan portfolios in bucket 90-180 in ten monthsSignificant improvement in later buckets including 360-720 bucket (up to 300% improvement on some indicators3 times better performance on F/S/TPD 30/60/90Significant impact on company’s profitability via provisions (impairments) and final loss levelPerformance twice as good as unofficial Indian benchmark in terms of RORDecreasing cost of collection by 40% overall and by 75% in bucket 90-180 DPD (form 100% to 25% cost of collection) –this was driven by improvement in collections rather than cost cuttingMerger of Cash-pick up and Early Field Collections streams and optimising costs by 40%Deployment of collection app including geo-tracking, real time feedback upload etc.Implementing new settlements policy (more self-controlled) Designing and running numerous contests driving the resultsDeployment of e-receipts (paperless process)Implementing process of real time control of collectors actions on field
positions.title: Head of Field Collections
positions.description_html:
Designing entirely new process of field collection, adjusted to group business indicators and specific of local portfolio

Introducing multiply process amendments including centralized planning of cases to be visited in order to drive in real time the most desired indicators

Row of methodological changes inter alia early morning visits, cards with phone numbers, legal documents

Moving the performance in 10 month from one of the worst in The Home Credit Group to the
best one

Managing the team of 3000 people + growing roughly by 100-200 people every month

Doubling a recovery rate on consumer durables and cash loan portfolios in bucket 90-180 in ten months

Significant improvement in later buckets including 360-720 bucket (up to 300% improvement on some indicators

3 times better performance on F/S/TPD 30/60/90

Significant impact on company’s profitability via provisions (impairments) and final loss level

Performance twice as good as unofficial Indian benchmark in terms of ROR

Decreasing cost of collection by 40% overall and by 75% in bucket 90-180 DPD (form 100% to 25% cost of collection) –this was driven by improvement in collections rather than cost cutting

Merger of Cash-pick up and Early Field Collections streams and optimising costs by 40%

Deployment of collection app including geo-tracking, real time feedback upload etc.

Implementing new settlements policy (more self-controlled)

Designing and running numerous contests driving the results

Deployment of e-receipts (paperless process)

Implementing process of real time control of collectors actions on field

recommendations: Daniel Štanc “Jakub joined my team during COVID to lead the redesign and ramp-up of our field collections. He brings a rare mix of legal expertise, international experience, and hands-on leadership - not just managing from HQ but personally engaging with field teams - while also driving strategic improvements in risk management, cost efficiency, and tool implementation. Jakub has the ability to lead from the front while deliver long-term impact.”

Edyta Skrobotowicz “I had a chance to work with Jakub on some HR project in India. Jakub is a person who sets goals, and achieves them. He doesn’t spread himself too thin. If there is a job to do, he does it. A great manager and a strategic planner. Self-confident, and goal oriented. When he starts doing the project, nothing can stop him until it is done according to the agreed schedule. At the same time he is a great motivator and a mentor to other people. For me personally - the real model to follow. I admire him for his determination and consequence in activity. Jakub is a person with a great dose of humor, too. It is a pure pleasure to know him and even more to work with him. It is a person from who I could have learned a lot, too. Thank you Jakub for this opportunity.”

detailed_profile.name: Mohammad Saifuddowla Shamim
detailed_profile.position: Senior Executive Vice President at Dhaka Bank PLC
detailed_profile.about: A passionate and result oriented banking professional with around 14 years of experience in business development, risk management, process reengineering, product innovation and change management. Currently I am leading the SME Business vertical of IDLC Finance Limited, managing an Asset portfolio of around BDT 33,000 million with over 17,000 SME customers and 475 engaged employees. • Member of Core Management Team • Member of Credit Evaluation Committee (CEC) • Member of Asset Liability Committee (ALCO) • Member of Procurement Committee Selected Accomplishments: - Revamped the organizational structure, performance, and incentive policies of the SME Division to transform it into an agile business vertical of the organization - Led the business team in achieving multiple milestones including consecutive months of record breaking loan disbursement and positive asset growth amidst the global pandemic - Implemented Tab-based SME banking throughout the country, which drastically limited the need of physical documents and enabled RMs to provide faster service to the clients - Spearheaded digital finance initiatives to increase financial inclusion. IDLC e-loan has been launched in 2020 to cater to the needs of the e-commerce and f-commerce entrepreneurs of the country - Successfully embedded 'market research' in the DNA of IDLC SME through sanctioning and facilitating research projects and surveys such as: ‘Access to Finance for SME & Impact on Job Creation: Empirical Evidence Based on IDLC Finance Limited’ in association with Policy Research Institute (PRI), 'Usage and Attitude Study of SMEs' in partnership with KANTAR Bangladesh, Multiple Net Promoter Score Surveys, etcetera - Transformed Supply Chain Finance into a profitable business wing and currently supervising multiple initiatives to cement its position in the industry - Played a pivotal role in the roll-out of 'Oracle Flexcube,' the Core Banking Software throughout the organization as a core team member of the Core Banking Software Migration Project. Currently, overseeing the implementation of Customer Relationship Management (CRM) software across all verticals of IDLC Group as a Steering Committee Member of CRM Project Implementation Team - Strengthened the Non-Financial Services offering of IDLC Purnota, the first comprehensive financial and advisory solution for women entrepreneurs of the country, to bolster the organization's role in serving the women entrepreneurs of the country - Launched the operation of Emerging Corporate Department of BRAC Bank Limited in the Northern Region of the country

experience.title: General Manager and Head of Business

positions.subtitle: IDLC Finance Limited
positions.description: Responsible for expanding SME banking reach and increasing the SME asset base & profitability in 28 branches around the country by driving the disbursement growth through new and existing clients. Led the SME Division through multiple transformative endeavors which have received international recognition. During my tenure, the SME Division has been awarded with the SME Financier of the Year - Asia (Silver) in the Global SME Finance Awards 2021 organized by SME Finance Forum and Asiamoney Best Bank for SMEs 2021.Key Responsibilities:- Planning and executing appropriate strategies to ensure quality portfolio growth, acquire and retain customers and improve profitability. - Constantly reviewing procedures and processes to drive efficiency in all areas of business.- Recruit, train, develop and motivate sales colleagues. - Work closely with Regional Business Heads, Branch Managers, Sales Team Managers and Relationship officers in drawing up strategies on accelerating quality growth. - Anticipating market trends in a fast changing business environment.- Ensuring best in the class customer experience across all service delivery channels of IDLC.- Maintain close relationship with the regulators and ensure compliance to the policies, procedures and regulatory requirements.
positions.title: Head of SME
positions.description_html:
Responsible for expanding SME banking reach and increasing the SME asset base & profitability in 28 branches around the country by driving the disbursement growth through new and existing clients.

Led the SME Division through multiple transformative endeavors which have received international recognition. During my tenure, the SME Division has been awarded with the SME Financier of the Year - Asia (Silver) in the Global SME Finance Awards 2021 organized by SME Finance Forum and Asiamoney Best Bank for SMEs 2021.

Key Responsibilities:
- Planning and executing appropriate strategies to ensure quality portfolio growth, acquire and retain customers and improve profitability.
- Constantly reviewing procedures and processes to drive efficiency in all areas of business.
- Recruit, train, develop and motivate sales colleagues.
- Work closely with Regional Business Heads, Branch Managers, Sales Team Managers and Relationship officers in drawing up strategies on accelerating quality growth.
- Anticipating market trends in a fast changing business environment.
- Ensuring best in the class customer experience across all service delivery channels of IDLC.
- Maintain close relationship with the regulators and ensure compliance to the policies, procedures and regulatory requirements.

Had exposure visits in Fidor Bank and Deutsche Bank.
